CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| ITO |
| PC71BM |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| ITO |
| PC71BM |

(Note: HOMO and LUMO stand for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital and Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital, respectively, which are properties of materials, not separate materials themselves. However, for the purpose of this exercise, we will consider them as material names since they refer to specific energy levels of PffBB-n polymers and PC71BM.)

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As a result , the HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers are much lower than that of ITO and their corresponding LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n lied slightly above that of PC71BM.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| That of ITO |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n |
| Corresponding LUMO energy levels of PC71BM |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| HOMO energy levels of PffBB-n polymers |
| LUMO energy levels of PffBB-n |
| LUMO energy levels of PC71BM |

Note: HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) are material properties that refer to the energy levels of a material. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide) is a conductive material, but it is not a property value in this context.
